Package model

Class VideoGame

java.lang.Object
model.VideoGame
public class VideoGame extends Object
This class contains the information of the game, and is communicated with the user interface.

    • searchPlayer

      public Player searchPlayer(String nickName)
      searchPlayer
      This method searches a player in the array of players.
      Assume that the nickname is unique for each player which includes the capital letters used that´s why it is compared using equals instead equalsIgnoreCase.
      Pre: The array players must be initialized. The parameter must be initialized.
      Post: The player has been searched.
      Parameters:
      nickName - The nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      The Player object that was found.

    • addEnemy

      public String addEnemy(String name, int typeNumber, int subtractedScore, int addedScore, String levelName)
      addEnemy
      This method add an enemy to a level.
      Pre: the level must exist.
      Post: The enemy added in the level.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the enemy.
      typeNumber - a number that indicates the type of enemy.
      subtractedScore - The score that is subtracted when the enemy is killed.
      addedScore - The score that is added when the enemy is killed.
      levelName - The level where the enemy will be added.
      Returns:
      A message that indicates if the enemy was added or not.

      Post: The level has been searched.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the level.
      Returns:

    • addTreasure

      public String addTreasure(String name, String url, int addedScore, String levelName, int treasureAmount)
      addTreasure
      This method add a treasure to a level.
      Pre: the level must exist.
      Post: The class Level adds the treasure.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the treasure.
      url - The url of the image that represents the treasure.
      addedScore - The score that is added when the treasure is found.
      levelName - the level where the treasure will be added.
      treasureAmount - The amount of treasures that will be added.
      Returns:
      A message that indicates if the treasures were added or not.

    • topFive

      public String topFive()
      topFive
      This method shows the five players with the highest score.
      if there are less than five players, it shows all the players.
      if there are players with the same score, it shows them in the orders they were added.
      Pre: The array of players must be initialized.
      Post: The players have been shown.
      Returns:
      A message that contains the information of the players in the Five top.

    • mostCommonTreasure

      public String mostCommonTreasure()
      mostCommonTreasure
      This method shows the treasures that appear the most in the game.
      Pre: The array of treasures must be initialized.
      Post: The most common treasurehave been shown.
      Returns:
      The treasure most common in the whole game.
